function_category: Scoring with Machine Learning Engine Models
short_description: This function generates predictions on a response variable for a data set
long_description: This function uses a decision tree model from the forest_drive to create predictions on a response variable for a test set

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input test data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input test data.

input_tables.name: Model
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the model data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the model data.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set

argument_clauses.name: NumericInputs
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the numeric predictor variables. By default, the function gets these variables from the model generated by ta.forest_drive. If you specify this argument, you must specify it exactly as you specified it in the ta.forest_drive call that generated the model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the numeric predictor variables. By default, the function gets these variables from the model generated by Forest_Drive. If you specify this argument, you must specify it exactly as you specified it in the Forest_Drive call that generated the model.

argument_clauses.name: CategoricalInputs
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the categorical predictor variables. By default, the function gets these variables from the model generated by ta.forest_drive. If you specify this argument, you must specify it exactly as you specified it in the ta.forest_drive call that generated the model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the categorical predictor variables. By default, the function gets these variables from the model generated by Forest_Drive. If you specify this argument, you must specify it exactly as you specified it in the Forest_Drive call that generated the model.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Detailed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output detailed information about the forest trees; that is, the decision tree and the specific tree information, including task index and tree index for each tree. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to output detailed information about the forest trees; that is, the decision tree and the specific tree information, including task index and tree index for each tree. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: Responses
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies responses for which to output probabilities.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies responses for which to output probabilities.
